io.github.rsk3110.riskgame

Class AttackCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rsk3110.riskgame.AttackCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class AttackCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
    Rules for Attack command. If player attacks a opposing player territory, the user will decide how many dice they want to roll. Territory must have (#dice + 1) armies to roll that amount of dice; The territory that loses a confrontation will lose 1 army (#confrontations = minimum #dice of attacker and defender, defender wins on tie) If defender's army drops to, attacker claims target territory and moves (#dice) armies from origin to target.

      • execute

        public boolean execute(Player player,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Executes the attack command. Checks for valid number of arguments entered {attack origin target} Checks if valid territories were selected, if not end turn If valid territories are entered, move on to (call method) attack.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        player - player executing the command
        args - stores arguments listed after the command attack
        Returns:
        whether to hand control to next player
